label: 渤海
本: The Cambridge History of Japan, Volume 2:  Heian Japan . Cambridge University Press . 1999
説明文: Bordering China on the west and Silla south of P'yongyang, Po-hai was a large state that at its greatest extent occupied the area of present-day northeastern China (in Chi-lin ad Hei-lung-chiang), North Korea, and the Russian Maritime Province (p. 90). ↓[HW: Also Parhae; 698-926.]
